title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
description: When trying to create a new class within a nested class using the new class wizard, the wizard does not correctly determine the enclosing type context.
OB: With a .java file open in the editor, clicking the new class button. Checking the 'Enclosing Type' field shows that it is blank.
EB: The 'Enclosing Type' field should default to the current type in the editor, accurately reflecting the nested class context.
SR:
To reproduce: 
1. Open a .java file in the editor.
2. Click the 'New class' button.
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field in the wizard.
4. Observe that the field is blank instead of defaulting to the current type in the editor.
